ygData.subject: boost graph library
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, it s been a while.  For about a year now I ve been working on my own implementation of NEAT in C++ in an effort to create a fast, templated implementation

Hey, it's been a while.  For about a year now I've been working on my own
implementation of NEAT in C++ in an effort to create a fast, templated
implementation that can be adapted to many problems.  Also, just for the
hell of it.  It all seems to be working quite well now and I'm in a bit of
a clean-up stage.  Currently all the structures are implemented using std
vectors, etc.  I did many benchmarks comparing this approach to others and
the std library seems to provide performance on par or better than more
"customized" implementations I came up with.  Plus, when I was at SDWest I
learned that no matter how much stl I'm using in my code, it's not enough.
 Anyway, I also became aware of the Boost Graph library.  Long story short
(too late) I was wondering if anyone has used the library, specifically
with NEAT.  I want to consider doing a NEAT implementation using it but
it's going to be a lot of work and I'm not completely sure it's possible. 
Just thought I'd check with everyone before I embark on this.  Also, at
some point I will publish what I've done.  I just want to finish cleaning
it all up.  Thanks for any info.  Regards,

jeff
